oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Royal Crown Cola - 1946-02-16 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Royal Crown Cola sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from February 16, 1946. Featuring Ernie Keller (announcer), Louie Buck (host) and performers Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys with vocalists Cowboy Copas and Becky Barfield, George Wilkerson and his Fruit Jar Drinkers, Ernest Tubb and his Texas Troubadours, the Short Brothers of Jimmy Short and Leon Short (members of the Texas Troubadours), Wally Fowler and his Oak Ridge Quartet, and Bradley Kincaid. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Pee Wee King; Golden West Cowboys; George Wilkerson; Fruit Jar Drinkers; Ernest Tubb; Texas Troubadours; Short Brothers; Cowboy Copas
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Oxydol commercial -- Opening statement (Ernie Keller) -- Opening theme -- Ernie Keller introduces Louie Buck -- Louie Buck introduces Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys -- Columbus Stockade Blues (Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys) -- Louie Buck introduces George Wilkerson and his Fruit Jar Drinkers -- Sally Gooden (George Wilkerson and his Fruit Jar Drinkers, Pee Wee King) -- Louie Buck introduces Ernest Tubb -- When Love Turns To Hate (Ernest Tubb and his Texas Troubadours) -- Royal Crown Cola commercial (Louie Buck, Pee Wee King, Ernie Keller) -- Louie Buck introduces Jimmy Short and Leon Short -- Blue Kimono Blues (Short Brothers) -- Louie Buck introduces Cowboy Copas and the Golden West Cowboys -- Filipino Baby (Cowboy Copas, Golden West Cowboys)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Keller, Ernie; Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; King, Pee Wee, 1914-2000; Golden West Cowboys (Musical group); Copas, Cowboy; Barfield, Becky; Fowler, Wally; Oak Ridge Quartet; Oak Ridge Boys; Wilkerson, George W., 1895-1954; Fruit Jar Drinkers (Musical group); Tubb, Ernest, 1914-1984; Texas Troubadours; Short Brothers (Musical group); Short, Jimmie; Short, Leon; Kincaid, Bradley; Stewart, Redd; Boyd, Shorty
